questions.question_text: What are two Symptom types? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B. Fault
C. Metric / Property

Selected Answer: A
Log Insight so its A its under the LOGS tab:
https://www.brockpeterson.com/post/troubleshoot-with-vmware-vrealize-operations

questions.question_text:
An administrator is using the troubleshooting workbench in vRealize Operations for troubleshooting purposes.
Which other vRealize Suite product's data will be shown in this view when the integration is configured?
How is Business Intent applied to objects in vRealize Operations?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
That should be Tags so its C:
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Operations/8.10/com.vmware.vcom.core.doc/GUID-5214192B-A4DB-42C5-8698-E577BAEEC71A.html

questions.question_text:
Within a large enterprise IT department, a member of the monitoring team has moved to another role within the operations team. The administrator's user account was initially assigned the PowerUserMinusRemediation role, but the PowerUser role has now been added by the helpdesk team following the job change.
Which statement accurately describes the nature of this change?

choices.A: The administrator will now be able to complete tasks associated with remediation actions.
choices.D: The administrator will remain unable to complete tasks associated with remediation actions.
choices.B: The administrator will now be able to perform cluster management tasks but unable to complete remediation actions.
choices.C: The administrator will now be able to perform user management tasks and remediation actions.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
PowerUser cannot manage users: https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Operations/8.10/com.vmware.vcom.core.doc/GUID-9F316466-FACA-4DA0-8F3E-51BC73793990.html

Selected Answer: A
After more thinking about it I think user management will not be possible so A

Selected Answer: C
Did not find that but I believe correct is C will be able also to remediate.

Selected Answer: B
Only B makes any sense.

choices.D: Disable the alert in all polices

questions.question_text:
An administrator has been notified of a critical alert associated with a VMware vCenter cloud account. The alert states that "Objects are not receiving data from adapter instance". The administrator investigated the problem and resolved the underlying issue. The administrator now needs to stop the alert from triggering again, unless the problem occurs in the future.
Which alert action should the administrator take to meet the criteria?
